intro: Galeopsis tetrahit var. acuminata, commonly known as the sharpleaf hedge nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
